title: Anti-Lebanon Mountains
summary: The Anti-Lebanon Mountains (Arabic: جبال لبنان الشرقية‎, romanized: Jibāl Lubnān ash-Sharqiyyah, lit. 'Eastern Mountains of Lebanon'; Lebanese Arabic: جبال الشرقية, Jbel esh-Shar'iyyeh, "Eastern Mountains") are a southwest–northeast-trending mountain range that forms most of the border between Syria and Lebanon. The border is largely defined along the crest of the range. Most of the range lies in Syria.
